title: GitHub Repository Bot
author: Rajan Selvan
onboarding: This bot is designed to assist you in managing your GitHub repositories efficiently. You can use the following commands and parameters to interact with it.

commands.name: Create README
commands.description: Generates a README file for your repository with the specified parameters.

commands.name: Generate Changelog
commands.description: Automatically generates a changelog file based on your project's commit history.

commands.name: Add License
commands.description: Adds a license file to your repository for legal compliance. Specify the license type as a parameter.

commands.name: Customize Styles
commands.description: Allows you to customize the styling of your project. Specify theme or style options as parameters.

commands.name: Manage Issues
commands.description: Provides various options for managing issues in your repository, such as creating, closing, or assigning issues.

README.description: Use this command to generate a README file with project details, instructions, and documentation.

Changelog.description: Automatically create a changelog file to track changes in your project over time.

License.description: Ensure legal compliance by adding an appropriate license file to your repository.

Styles.description: Personalize your project's styling by applying predefined themes or custom styles.

Issues.description: Efficiently handle issues in your repository, from creation to resolution.

use_cases.workflow: Use '/create-readme <parameters>' to generate comprehensive project documentation in a README file.
Automate changelog creation with '/generate-changelog <parameters>' to keep track of version changes.
Use '/add-license <parameters>' to add the appropriate license to your repository for legal protection.
Customize your project's styling with '/customize-styles <parameters>' to match your brand or preferences.
Efficiently manage project issues with '/manage-issues <parameters>' to keep your project organized.
